alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Clayton and Grant Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Colesburg to near Epworth. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cassville around 935 PM CDT. Guttenberg around 940 PM CDT. Bloomington around 1000 PM CDT. Dickeyville around 1005 PM CDT. Lancaster around 1025 PM CDT. Boscobel around 1030 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Arthur, Turkey River, Beetown, Fairview, Nelson Dewey State Park, Lancaster Municipal Airport, Blue River and Millville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
